The privacy of the campaign determines who can view the shared data associated with the campaign. Remember, all data is private until you mark it shared on-line.

A campaign may be in one of two privacy states:
* private: only you and the administrator can see your data, even if it is shared.
* shared: administrators, authors and analysis can see your shared data.

The above displays the status of the campaign.

Normally, you are either participating in a campaign, meaning the associated surveys are available for you to complete on your phone, or the campaign is available for participation meaning that you can download the campaign and its surveys to your phone. Any other status indicates that there\'s a problem with the campaign.
